definitions: To leave a place, especially a vehicle or animal.
To avoid punishment or a difficult situation.
To send something, such as a letter or package.
To start a journey or race.
To experience sexual pleasure or excitement.
examples: I need to get off the bus at the next stop.
He was lucky to get off with just a warning.
Did you get off that email to the client?
The racehorses got off to a good start.
The music really helps me get off.
